Oh no! Your forecast for your energy production is wrong!
What action will you undertake?

answers.answer: Import more energy from other producers.
There is nothing I can do.

popup.text:
Following the climate protests in Brussels, the Belgian Government has decided to close down all non-renewable energy sources and fully rely on renewable energy. (Implying the government bought enough renewable energy sources to sustain the needs of Belgium.)
Why is this a bad choice?

answers.answer: Many people will lose their job, because a lot of power stations will be shutdown.
This is in fact not a bad choice. Relying on renewable energy sources gives us the opportunity to reduce pollution and fight climate change.
Because renewable energy sources are not always reliable, and therefore can cause power outages if the produced quota does not meet the consumed quota.

popup.text:
You have received a new forecast! It indicates that the total amount of energy produced by both your renewable and non-renewable energy sources will be higher than necessary to fulfill the energy consumption for today, but will decrease heavily tomorrow because of a cloudy day.
What action will you undertake?

answers.answer: Decrease/Increase production of my non-renewable energy sources accordingly
Leave my non-renewable energy sources be. They will produce too much the 1st day, but will produce enough the 2nd day.
Decrease production of my non-renewable energy sources so I don't have an overproduction on the 1st day.

How much energy from a coal power plant makes it to customers as electricity?
popup.note: About a third of the energy from a steam coal power plant makes it to customers as electricity. A very efficient type of natural gas plant, called combined cycle, typically converts about 40% of the fuel into electricity, with advanced units capable of 60% efficiency.

What country is the premier source of steel for nuclear power plants?
popup.note: Japan Steel Works long was the only foundry that could forge a reactor vessel in one piece, seen as essential to reduce risk of leaks. But China and Russia now have the capacity, and new facilities are under construction.

What global treaty has slashed world greenhouse gas emissions by 11 gigatons a year?

answers.answer: The United Nations Frakework Convention on Climate Change
The United Nations Convention on the Law of the Sea

popup.note: The 1990 Montreal Protocol, in phasing out ozone-depleted substances with high global warming potential, had the side benefit of eliminating the equivalent of 11 gigatons a year of carbon dioxide emissions by 2010. (about 5 to 6 times the target set for the first period of the Kyoto Protocol on climate change)

Estimates of what U.S. fuel resource have grown 40% or more since 2006?
popup.note: Estimates of U.S. natural gas have grown 40% or more since 2006, thanks to the success of hydraulic fracturing technology, making huge reserves now recoverable.

popup.text:

Do any cars run on coal
popup.note: No cars run directly on coal, but about 30% of South Africa's transportation needs are met by a diesel fuel that is processed from coal. When oil prices soared in the U.S., there was a frenzy of interest in coal-to-liquids there, although there are concerns about its high-carbon intensity.

What solution is said to have potential for 57% of needed carbon cuts by 2030?
popup.note: The International Energy Agency's scenario for stabilizing the atmospheric concentration of carbon dioxide at 450 parts per million would get 57% of the cuts from efficiency gains.

popup.text:

Are there any choices for electricity generation that don't rely on water?
popup.note: No. Coal, nuclear, natural gas, and solar thermal plants all produce electricity by boiling water into steam to turn turbines. Wind and solar photovoltaic power use much less water, but regular water use is still needed to keep the blades nd panels clean or their operation degrades

Does ethanol always deliver lower fuel economy than gasoline?
popup.note: Yes. Because of ethanol's lower energy content, it takes 1.03 gallons (3.90 liters) of E10 (the most common blend, which is gasoline with 10% ethanol) to travel as far as 1 gallon (3.79 liters) of regular gasoline. It takes 1.33 gallons (5.03 liters) if the blend is increased to 85% ethanol

popup.text:
BONUS
Can solar power provide electricity when the sun isn't shining?
popup.note: Many solar energy systems have battery storage, allowing users to draw energy at night. Large solar thermal power projects are coming online that use molten salt to store energy for use after dark.
